FuncDef: The display tcp ipv6 status command displays all IPv6 TCP connections.
CLIs: display tcp ipv6 status [ local-ip <local-ip> | local-port <local-port> | remote-ip <remote-ip> | remote-port <remote-port> ] * [ cid <cid> ] [ socket-id <socket-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the IPv6 TCP onnection with a specified local IP address.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified local port number.
The value ranges from 0 to 65535.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified remote IP address.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified remote port number.
The value ranges from 0 to 65535.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified APP CID.
The value is a hexadecimal integer that ranges from 0 to ffffffff.

Displays the IPv6 TCP connection with a specified socket ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 2147418111.

Examples: Cid/SocketID         Local Address                Foreign Address              VPNID      State
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
TCP defined in standard protocols ensures high-reliability transmission between hosts. TCP provides reliable, connection-oriented, and full-duplex services for user processes. To monitor the TCP connection status, run he display tcp status command to check the following information:
IPv6 TCP socket IDAPP CIDLocal IPv6 address and port numberRemote IPv6 address and port numberVPNIDIPv6 TCP connection status
A filtering rule, such as a socket ID, local IP address, local port number, remote IP address, or remote port number, can be specified so that only the information matching the rule is displayed. This reduces the amount of output information, improving output information usability and fault locating accuracy and efficiency.

Precautions
If no TCP connection is available, the command output is empty.
